solution_line_template: She ordered 4 1/2 pound steaks so that's {num_steaks}*{steak_weight_per_steak} = <<{num_steaks}*{steak_weight_per_steak}={total_steak_pounds}>>{total_steak_pounds} pounds of steak.

The steak cost ${steak_cost_per_pound} a pound and she bought {total_steak_pounds} pounds so that's {steak_cost_per_pound}*{total_steak_pounds} = $<<{steak_cost_per_pound}*{total_steak_pounds}={total_steak_cost}>>{total_steak_cost} for 4 steaks.

She also needed {chicken_pounds} pounds of chicken breasts at ${chicken_cost_per_pound} a pound so that's {chicken_pounds}*{chicken_cost_per_pound} = $<<{chicken_pounds}*{chicken_cost_per_pound}={total_chicken_cost}>>{total_chicken_cost} for chicken.

The steaks cost ${total_steak_cost} and the chicken cost ${total_chicken_cost} for a total of {total_steak_cost}+{total_chicken_cost} = $<<{total_steak_cost}+{total_chicken_cost}={total_spent}>>{total_spent} spent at the butchers.
